title: Soprano Anna Patalong: why I'm giving opera its Fleabag moment
text:
The world of opera has rarely been kind to its female characters. But it is about to have a “Fleabag” moment, thanks to one soprano.

This week the BBC Symphony Orchestra will perform Miss Julie, based on August Strindberg’s 19th century play, with Anna Patalong as the doomed heroine.

Miss Julie has been dubbed a “misogynist classic” and Strindberg was notorious for his sexism. But Patalong has re-imagined the character and taken Phoebe Waller-Bridge’s Fleabag as inspiration - a riposte to an art form in which “all women die”.

“I think Strindberg originally wanted Miss Julie to be an unlikeable character, and perhaps when it was performed in that day and age she was.
